_comment: Created by JMorris on 15/02/2018 14:45:08 using v2.7
title: How has the smoking status of pregnant women and the number of maternities changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
The absolute number of pregnant women who are known to be smokers at the time of delivery has also been decreasing in recent years. In 2016/17, about 65,000 pregnant women were known to be smokers, a decrease of over 25,500 women since 2006/07. However, the total number of maternities has also been decreasing from 665,000 in 2011/12 to 619,000 in 2016/17, representing an overall decrease of 6.8%.

Updated December 2017.
data_source: NHS Digital, Statistics on Women's Smoking Status at Time of Delivery
